results.name: a(n) = [x^n] Sum_{k>=0} x^k/Product_{j=1..k} (1 + n*j*x).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..282
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Bell Polynomial
formula: a(n) = n! * [x^n] exp((1 - exp(-n*x))/n), for n > 0.
mathematica: Table[SeriesCoefficient[Sum[x^k/Product[(1 + n j x), {j, 1, k}], {k, 0, n}], {x, 0, n}], {n, 0, 19}]
Join[{1}, Table[n! SeriesCoefficient[Exp[(1 - Exp[-n x])/n], {x, 0, n}], {n, 19}]]
Join[{1}, Table[Sum[(-n)^(n - k) StirlingS2[n, k], {k, n}], {n, 19}]]
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 20 2018
